00112 //
00113 // symbols.h
00114 //
00115 
00116 #if !defined(__SYMBOLS_H)
00117 #define __SYMBOLS_H 1
00118 
00119 #include "memory.h"
00120 
00121 typedef enum symbolkind {
00122    MACRO_S
00123 } symbolkind;
00124 
00125 // Typedefs for things defined here in "symbols.h":
00126 
00127 typedef struct Scope_Rec Scope;
00128 typedef struct Symbol_Rec Symbol;
00129 
00130 typedef struct SymbolList_Rec {
00131     struct SymbolList_Rec *next;
00132     Symbol *symb;
00133 } SymbolList;
00134 
00135 struct Scope_Rec {
00136     Scope *next, *prev;     // doubly-linked list of all scopes
00137     Scope *parent;
00138     Scope *funScope;        // Points to base scope of enclosing function
00139     MemoryPool *pool;       // pool used for allocation in this scope
00140     Symbol *symbols;
00141     
00142    int level;              // 0 = super globals, 1 = globals, etc.
00143 
00144     // Only used at global scope (level 1):
00145     SymbolList *programs;   // List of programs for this compilation.
00146 };
00147 
00148 
00149 // Symbol table is a simple binary tree.
00150 
00151 #include "cpp.h"        // to get MacroSymbol def
00152 
00153 struct Symbol_Rec {
00154     Symbol *left, *right;
00155     Symbol *next;
00156     int name;       // Name atom
00157     SourceLoc loc;
00158     symbolkind kind;
00159     union {
00160         MacroSymbol mac;
00161     } details;
00162 };
00163 
00164 extern Scope *CurrentScope;
00165 extern Scope *GlobalScope;
00166 extern Scope *ScopeList;
00167 
00168 Scope *NewScopeInPool(MemoryPool *);
00169 #define NewScope()      NewScopeInPool(CurrentScope->pool)
00170 void PushScope(Scope *fScope);
00171 Scope *PopScope(void);
00172 Symbol *NewSymbol(SourceLoc *loc, Scope *fScope, int name, symbolkind kind);
00173 Symbol *AddSymbol(SourceLoc *loc, Scope *fScope, int atom, symbolkind kind);
00174 Symbol *LookUpLocalSymbol(Scope *fScope, int atom);
00175 Symbol *LookUpSymbol(Scope *fScope, int atom);
00176 void CPPErrorToInfoLog(char *);
00177 
00178 
00179 #endif // !defined(__SYMBOLS_H)
